mdRecord.dcterms:title: The Voice of Prince Edward County, Vol. 4, No. 1
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "After School What?" - Robert Booker - Questions posed to the highschooler as to whether he/she is ready for the work world. / "Famous Negroes" - Henry Ossawa Tanner and Varian Jackson - In this portion of the series exploring famous Black pioneers, Henry Tanner's life is chronicled. / "Negro Employment in Prince Edward" - Robert Booker - Questions the employment opportunities for the Black community in Prince Edward County. / "Editorial: What the Negro Wants from Society" - Author Unknown - A cry that the Black community just wants true equality. / "Editorial: 100 Years in Review in Negro History" - Author Unknown - A celebration of Black history week.
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Various Contributors
Harold P. White, editor
Leroy Ross, editor
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: African American newspapers
Associations, institutions, etc.—African American membership
Race discrimination—United States
Prince Edward County (Va.)
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The Voice of Prince Edward County
